revised_title: Early Ionospheric Research and the Development of Electric and Magnetic Wave Theory
tldr: This article discusses the early days of ionospheric research and the development of electric and magnetic wave theory in Australia, New Zealand, and at the Halley Stewart Laboratory in London. It highlights the contributions of key scientists, such as Madsen, Laby, and Appleton, and their collaborations in expanding university research and training many postgraduate students in the field.
